page.title: 08HEALTH-N.LEEDS SPECIAL CARE.
page.content: ST. GEMMA'S HOSPICE. Inspired by the work of the Sisters of The Poor,caring for the dying in Africa,Dr. Thomas West persuaded some sisters to return and train at St. Christopher's Hospice in London.A hospice serves the needs of the terminally ill which ordinary hospitals cannot provide. The Sisters of the Cross and Passion set up a hospice in Leeds in 1978,opened by Prince and Princess of Wales. The Government provide a small amount of money but most of the cost come from the efforts of the public e.g. sponsored walks,"bed-pushes" and collections. The patients amuse themselves using their talents to raise money,make presents for family and employ craft work to exercise their minds.
